casebody.data:
729 A.2d 50 LINCOLN HEIGHTS ASSOCIATION, A NON PROFIT CORPORATION OF THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY, PLAINTIFF-APPELLANT, v. TOWNSHIP OF CRANFORD PLANNING BOARD, EDWARDS SUPER FOOD STORE, CRANE REALTY, L.P., AND TOWNSHIP COMMITTEE OF THE TOWNSHIP OF CRANFORD, DEFENDANTS-RESPONDENTS. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Argued April 21, 1999 — Decided May 11, 1999.

Before Judges KING, WALLACE and NEWMAN.

Jeffrey Kantowitz, argued the cause for appellant (Goldberg, Mufson & Spar, attorneys; Mr. Kantowitz, on the brief). Brian W. Fahey, argued the cause for respondent Crane Realty (Fahey & Fahey, attorneys; Mr. Fahey, on the brief). Joseph P. Depa, Jr., appeared for respondent Planning Board of the Township of Cranford. Albert N. Stender appeared for respondent, Township Committee of the Township of Cranford. *356PER CURIAM.

We affirm for the reasons expressed in Judge Pisansky’s well reasoned opinion reported at 314 N.J.Super. 366, 714 A.2d 995 (Law Div.1998).

Affirmed.
